video_description: A video review of the Acer Iconia Tab A100 Android Honeycomb Tablet. Check out our full review at: http://www.mobiletechreview.com/tablets/Acer-Iconia-Tab-A100.htm The Acer Iconia A100 is a 7" Android Honeycomb 3.2 tablet that runs on NVIDIA Tegra 2 dual core CPU with multi-touch screen that plays full 1080p video. The tablet has HDMI out port, a 5 megapixel rear camera with 720p recording and a 2 megapixel front camera for video chat. It has Android Market support and has built-in WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS.
title: Acer Iconia Tab A100 Review

Samsung's products though aren't something I'd always associate with quality, their phones for instance are oh so plasticy.﻿

comments.text: The codec split a video automatic in different categories, high- mid- low- profile (and more).﻿ But Lisa means the bitrate of the video (if the bitrate over 10Mbit/s, the codec says, that the video is highprofile, for example). You can download 1080p videos with 5Mbit/s or 20 (or more) Mbit/s. The 20Mbit/ Video needs much more power as the 5Mbit/s Video. Sorry for my terrible english :(

comments.text:
The Acer Iconia Tab A100 is great, and is one of the best gadgets that I have ever bought. It is also the first Android device that I have ever used.
For the past few months I wanted an Android Tablet.
After doing some research on different Android Tablets I decided to get the Acer Iconia Tab A100 7in, and so far I am very happy with my purchase.
I would definitely recommend the Acer Iconia Tab﻿ A100 to anyone that is looking for an Android Tablet that doesn't want a big/bulky 10.1in tablet.
